title: mStore Rating Schema
description: Defines the structure for a single rating document in the 'ratings' collection.

$schema.description: A reference to this schema file for validation and documentation purposes.

meta.description: Core metadata about the rating document.

ratingId.description: The unique identifier for the rating, following the global ID format (e.g., RTG-...).

flags.description: Boolean flags to track the state of the rating.

isHighImpact.description: True if the rating is low (e.g., 1 or 2 stars), indicating it needs urgent attention.

guest.description: True if the rating was submitted by a non-logged-in user.

userId.description: The user ID of the person taking the action, regardless of their role.

orderId.description: ID of the order this rating is for, if applicable.

itemId.description: ID of the item this rating is for, if applicable.

merchantId.description: The merchant ID of the submitter, if the submitter is a merchant. Can also be the ID of the merchant being rated in other contexts.

submitter.description: Information about the user who submitted the rating.

id.description: The primary identifier of the submitter. This will be the userId for consumers/admins, and the merchantId for merchants. Null for guests.

role.description: The role of the user at the time of submission.

submittedAt.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp when the rating was submitted.

details.description: The actual content of the rating.

comment.description: The optional text comment provided by the user.

tags.description: Tags selected by the user to describe their experience (e.g., 'great_ui', 'slow').

context.description: Contextual information about where and how the rating was submitted.

source.description: Where in the app the rating was triggered from (e.g., 'order_confirmation_page', 'manual_trigger').

triggerEvent.description: The specific event that triggered the rating prompt (e.g., 'order_completed', 'user_initiated_rating').

appVersion.description: The version of the app when the rating was submitted.

platform.description: The platform the user was on (e.g., 'web_mobile', 'web_desktop').

lifecycle.description: Tracks the administrative lifecycle of the rating.

status.description: The current status of the rating.

history.description: A log of all status changes and actions taken on the rating.

note.description: An optional note about the status change.
